name: The Polytechnic, Ibadan
data: The Polytechnic, Ibadan is a public tertiary institution located in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. It was established on August 7, 1970 as a successor to the Technical College, Ibadan under the Polytechnic Ibadan Edict 1970, with the mandate to provide technical and vocational education and training in applied science, engineering, environmental studies, commerce and agriculture. The institution operates a multi-campus structure and is known for its motto ‘Ise Loogun Ise’, a Yoruba phrase meaning ‘Work is the medicine for poverty’, symbolising the value of hard work. Over the years, the polytechnic has produced middle‑ and high‑level manpower for various industries and has evolved to include full‑time National Diploma (ND) and Higher National Diploma (HND) programmes, Daily Part‑Time Programme (DPP) and Continuing Education Centre (CEC) part‑time programmes. It houses several faculties – Engineering, Environmental Studies, Science, Business and Communication Studies, Financial Management Studies and Vocational & Technical Education – each offering a variety of ND and HND programmes. Admission into ND programmes requires at least five credit passes at O’level (including English and Mathematics) and a minimum UTME score prescribed by JAMB (typically 150)【495664491148919†L108-L115】. HND admission demands a relevant ND certificate with a minimum of lower credit, completion of at least one‑year industrial training, and five credit passes at O’level【495664491148919†L159-L245】. Daily Part‑Time and CEC part‑time programmes admit candidates who purchase part‑time admission forms through the JAMB platform and meet the same O’level credit requirements; DPP applicants must obtain a JAMB registration number and have a minimum UTME score of 150【703792631874867†L32-L126】【902312501591338†L25-L115】. The Polytechnic’s library system comprises a main library with about 79,500 volumes and 819 seating capacity and a newer ultra‑modern library with 2,000 seating capacity; the libraries provide resources such as audio‑visual materials, printing services and study spaces and operate Monday–Friday 8:00 am–10:00 pm during session and 8:00 am–3:00 pm during vacation【179531119284558†L207-L273】. Student support services include a health centre and eye clinic – an ultra‑modern complex with 18 bed spaces offering free medical services, laboratories, X‑ray, ambulance and 24‑hour service with doctors available 8:00 am–2:00 pm【45655668014284†L207-L310】; a sports unit with facilities for football, basketball, volleyball, tennis, squash and indoor games and active participation in national sports competitions【796822605274810†L207-L247】; and a Vocational Skills and Entrepreneurial Study Centre (VSESC) established in 2009 to equip students with functional skills and work habits for self‑reliance【6817475909647†L207-L225】. The Industrial Liaison and Placement Office (ILPO) oversees Students Industrial Work Experience Scheme (SIWES) placements and provides career guidance and counselling to students【375731841597382†L209-L273】.

visitor.name: Engr. Seyi Makinde (Governor of Oyo State)

university.name: The Polytechnic, Ibadan
university.motto: Ise Loogun Ise (Work is the medicine for poverty)

location.address: Sango‑Eleyele Express Road, P.M.B. 22, Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria

faculties.name: Faculty of Science
programs: HND Science Laboratory Technology (Chemistry, Biology/Microbiology, Biochemistry, Physics with Electronics, Geology)

faculties.name: Faculty of Environmental Studies
programs: ND Fine & Applied Arts (Ceramic, Sculpture, Textile & Design, Painting)
Post‑HND Professional Diploma in Urban & Regional Planning

faculties.name: Faculty of Business and Communication Studies
Faculty of Vocational & Technical Education
programs: Various trades via Vocational Skills & Entrepreneurship Centre (Short‑term certificates)

requirements: Obtain at least five (5) credit passes at O’level (WAEC/NECO/NABTEB) in relevant subjects including English and Mathematics at not more than two sittings【495664491148919†L108-L115】.
Score a minimum of 150 in the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME) and choose The Polytechnic, Ibadan as first choice in JAMB【495664491148919†L108-L115】.
Meet the departmental cut‑off mark and other specific requirements for the chosen programme【495664491148919†L159-L245】.
Possess a National Diploma (ND) in the relevant field with a minimum of Lower Credit grade from The Polytechnic, Ibadan or any other accredited institution【495664491148919†L159-L245】.
Have at least one year post‑ND industrial training experience (or two years for those with pass grade)【495664491148919†L159-L245】.
Provide evidence of transcripts from previous institution(s) and relevant professional experience【495664491148919†L159-L245】.
Have five (5) O’level credit passes including English and Mathematics (as required at ND entry)【495664491148919†L159-L245】.
Obtain a JAMB part‑time application form and register with a valid JAMB registration number【703792631874867†L32-L126】.
Possess five (5) credit passes at O’level including English and Mathematics, obtained in not more than two sittings【703792631874867†L32-L126】.
Achieve a minimum UTME score of 150 and choose the DPP option during registration【703792631874867†L32-L126】.
Apply through the institution’s admission portal and pay the prescribed application fee before the closing date (usually late July)【703792631874867†L32-L126】.
ND applicants: obtain a JAMB part‑time application form and register for The Polytechnic, Ibadan Continuing Education Centre (CEC) programme【902312501591338†L25-L115】.
HND applicants: hold a National Diploma in the relevant discipline with at least Lower Credit grade and meet the one‑year industrial attachment requirement【902312501591338†L25-L115】.
Have five (5) credit passes at O’level including English and Mathematics, at not more than two sittings【902312501591338†L25-L115】.
Pay the prescribed application fee and complete the online application form via the admissions portal【902312501591338†L25-L115】.

student_services.description: The polytechnic library system comprises a main library with 819 seating capacity and approximately 79,500 volumes of books, and an ultra‑modern library with about 2,000 seating capacity. Services include book lending, reference services, audio‑visual centre, printing unit and general study spaces. Library hours during session are Monday–Friday 8:00 am–10:00 pm, Saturday 8:00 am–1:00 pm; during vacation 8:00 am–3:00 pm; it is closed on Sundays and public holidays【179531119284558†L207-L273】.
student_services.location: Main and ultra‑modern libraries at the main campus
student_services.hours: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM (Monday–Friday), 8:00 AM – 1:00 PM (Saturday) during session; 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM during vacation【179531119284558†L207-L273】

student_services.description: A modern health facility located between the North and South Campuses offering free medical care to students and staff. The centre has an 18‑bed ward and provides services such as general outpatient care, eye clinic, laboratory investigations, X‑ray, immunization, ambulance services and emergency treatment. Doctors are available between 8:00 AM and 2:00 PM daily; nurses provide 24‑hour coverage【45655668014284†L207-L310】.
student_services.location: Middle Belt (between North and South campuses)

student_services.description: The Sports Unit provides facilities for football (three pitches), basketball, handball, volleyball, tennis, squash, chess and scrabble. The institution participates in national and West African Polytechnic games (NIPOGA and WAPOGA), offering scholarships to outstanding athletes and promoting staff fitness through welfare activities【796822605274810†L207-L247】.
student_services.location: North and South campuses sports grounds
student_services.hours: Varies (sports facilities available during daylight hours)

student_services.description: Established in 2009, VSESC equips students with functional vocational skills and entrepreneurial knowledge. All students must learn and master a trade before graduation; the centre also trains youths, civil servants and retirees to enhance job skills and foster self‑reliance【6817475909647†L207-L225】.
student_services.location: VSESC complex at the main campus

student_services.service: Industrial Liaison & Placement Office (ILPO) / SIWES Unit
student_services.description: ILPO manages the Students Industrial Work Experience Scheme (SIWES) by liaising with industry to secure placement for students, assists them with career planning and provides guidance and counselling for job opportunities. It collaborates with employers to ensure students gain practical training and helps students decide career paths【375731841597382†L209-L273】.
student_services.location: ILPO office, Administrative Block, main campus

fees.application_fee: Approximately ₦2,000 for part‑time application forms and ₦10,000 for HND application; specific amounts may vary by session.

tuition_fees.ND_full_time: Indigenes: ~₦82,000 per session (55,000 1st semester + 27,000 2nd semester); Non‑indigenes: ~₦88,000; DPP: ~₦116,000【837592719462207†L243-L315】.

directors.title: Director, Vocational Skills & Entrepreneurial Study Centre (VSESC)
directors.name: Director not specified
directors.description: Heads the centre responsible for vocational and entrepreneurial training for all students and external trainees【6817475909647†L207-L225】.

directors.title: Director, Industrial Liaison & Placement Office (ILPO)
directors.name: Director not specified
directors.description: Coordinates Students Industrial Work Experience Scheme (SIWES) placements, liaises with industry and provides career guidance and counselling【375731841597382†L209-L273】.

directors.title: Director, Sports Unit
directors.name: Director not specified
directors.description: Oversees sports development, coaching, competitions and fitness programmes for students and staff【796822605274810†L207-L247】.

directors.title: Director, Library Services
directors.name: Director not specified
directors.description: Manages the central and branch libraries, ensuring access to books, journals, e‑resources and study facilities【179531119284558†L207-L273】.

directors.title: Director, Health Services
directors.name: Director not specified
directors.description: Supervises the health centre and eye clinic providing medical care and health education to students and staff【45655668014284†L207-L310】.

hostels.name: Male Hostel
hostels.capacity: Not specified (campus provides hostel accommodation for male students)

hostels.name: Female Hostel
hostels.capacity: Not specified (campus provides hostel accommodation for female students)

accommodation.application_process: Students apply for hostel accommodation through the Student Affairs Division during admission and are allocated spaces based on availability.

extracurricular_activities.description: Engages students in theatrical performances and drama workshops, promoting creative expression.
Organises debates and public speaking events to enhance students’ oratory and critical‑thinking skills.
Offers various sports activities including football, basketball, volleyball, athletics and indoor games, with opportunities to compete at local and national levels.
Provides a platform for students to develop business ideas, participate in start‑up workshops and learn practical entrepreneurial skills.

behavior: Provide detailed information on programmes (ND, HND, DPP, CEC), admission requirements and facilities.
Highlight the institution’s values, motto and commitment to technical excellence and practical training.
Mention career prospects, industrial training opportunities and success stories of graduates.
Address objections or concerns about fees, cut‑off marks and programme suitability professionally and provide guidance.
Encourage the prospect to visit the campus or apply through the admission portal and emphasise the supportive environment.
Show understanding toward academic or personal issues and actively listen to the student’s concerns.
Provide specific assistance with course registration, fee payment, timetable access and other academic services via the student portal.
Refer the student to appropriate units (registry, bursary, hostel management, ICT, ILPO) when necessary and provide contact details.
Follow up with questions to ensure the issue is resolved and offer general advice on academic success and well‑being.
Encourage participation in extracurricular activities and utilisation of support services like the library, health centre and counselling.

change_department.contact_info: Contact the Registrar or visit the Admissions Office at the Academic Affairs Unit; forms and guidelines are available on request.

mode_of_lectures.undergraduate: Mainly physical with some blended e‑learning components
mode_of_lectures.postgraduate: Not applicable (institution focuses on ND/HND programmes)

library.operating_hours: 8:00 AM – 10:00 PM (Mon–Fri), 8:00 AM – 1:00 PM (Sat) during session; 8:00 AM – 3:00 PM during vacation【179531119284558†L207-L273】
library.rules: Maintain quiet, carry a student ID card for borrowing, no eating or drinking in the reading areas.

wifi.availability: Available for registered students in the library and selected areas on campus; access credentials are provided by the ICT Unit.
wifi.reset_info: Students can reset their portal and Wi‑Fi credentials through the ICT helpdesk or the student portal.

school_id.obtain_info: Students obtain the school ID card after completing registration at the Student Affairs Division; lost IDs can be replaced at a fee by contacting the Registry.
school_id.replacement_info: Apply for ID card replacement at the Registry with a police report and proof of payment.

course_forms.access: Students download and submit course forms through their respective departmental offices and the student portal during registration.

hostel.rules: Hostel rules include curfew hours, visitors’ policy and proper maintenance of facilities; students must abide by hall regulations issued by the Student Affairs Division.
hostel.fees: Hostel accommodation fees vary by session and range around ₦45,000 – ₦50,000 per session; a utility fee of about ₦25,000 may apply【511023136523833†L31-L52】.
hostel.visiting_hours: Official visiting hours are determined by the hall management and are typically during daylight hours; students should confirm with the hall administrators.

uses: Printing admission letters and clearance slips
Accessing lecture notes and e‑learning materials
student_portal.common_issues: Forgotten password, login errors and payment verification – resolved through the portal’s password reset function or by contacting the ICT Unit

payment_info.account_number: Not publicly available; payments are made via the school portal
payment_info.bank: Specific bank details provided on the payment invoice generated through the portal
